info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued August 04 at 4:06PM EDT until August 04 at 5:00PM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: The National Weather Service in Albany has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Schoharie County in east central New York... South central Montgomery County in eastern New York... * Until 500 PM EDT. * At 405 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Jefferson, or 14 miles southwest of Cobleskill, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Cobleskill, Jefferson, Middleburgh, Summit, Schoharie, Richmondville, Sharon Springs, Livingstonville, North Blenheim, Breakabeen, Central Bridge, Carlisle, Sharon, Seward, Zeh Corners, Beekman Corners, West Richmondville, Baird Corners, Rockwell Corners and Warnerville. Please report hail size...damaging winds and reports of trees down to the National Weather Service by email at Alb.Stormreport@noaa.gov... On Facebook at www.facebook.com/nwsalbany or twitter @nwsalbany HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
